intro: Sterculia urens, commonly known as the African sycamore, is a large evergreen tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its broad, glossy leaves and showy yellow flowers. The tree produces woody capsules that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It is often found in coastal forests and can grow up to 30 meters tall. The bark is thick and fissured, providing it with a rugged appearance.
